alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 3:46PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Carbon and southwestern Monroe Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pocono Pines, or near Mount Pocono, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Pocono, Pocono Pines, Gilbert, Pocono Raceway, Lake Harmony, McMichael, Blakeslee, Long Pond, Albrightsville, Sun Valley, Jonas, Meckesville, Christmans, Brodheadsville, Effort and Merwinsburg. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 86 and 90. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 286 and 300. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
